Reviews.Title: decent computer, decent price
Reviews.Author: twitchoh
Reviews.Content: ive had this computer since February, and i gotta say it has impressed me, though the processor is kinda lacking, it is a pretty sturdy little machine, and it gets FANTASTIC battery life, my only real complaint is that the network card likes to fail at completely random times, probably an isolated incident, as ive never heard of any of these doing that, but over all, for the price, this is an impressive laptop, i like it alot

Reviews.Title: Avoid at all costs
Reviews.Author: Amna Malik
Reviews.Content: I've been using laptops and desktops of all makes, shapes and sizes for the past 13 years and this has to be one of the poorest built laptops to ever be sold under the HP brand. Out of the box this laptop is inconsistent and crashes often. The software issues are on a whole other league of terrible.

Reviews.Title: A great computer at an affordable price
Reviews.Author: Selina
Reviews.Content: It is a great computer at an affordable price. Everything works great so far and I have nothing to complain about yet.

Reviews.Title: infuriatingly slow
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: this is the slowest computer I have ever used. Worthless for anything more than word processing, or simple spreadsheet. Opening pages, or control panel panes or just about anything results in painfully long delays. I have given up on hp products, as I have seen a steady decline in quality over the years. Invest your hard-earned dollars in a comparably priced Lenovo for a much better value.

Reviews.Title: loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee
Reviews.Author: victor
Reviews.Content: muy buena la maquina es rapida ,y es bonita no tan pesada y ademas excelente precioooo 100% positivo el vendedor

Reviews.Title: Slower than a tumbleweed on a calm day
Reviews.Author: Matthew R. Lemons "ML"
Reviews.Content: We purchased these for the teachers at our school.  As the IT guy I got to put our software on them.  Windows 7 is already a challenge for those who aren't tech savy so that aside while setting these machines up for use lets put it this way.  As I said in the description.  Slower than a tumbleweed on a calm day.Save your money and your sanity.  HP missed the mark once again.

ProductInfo.Features:
AMD Radeon HD 6310 Discrete-Class graphics, 15.6-inch diagonal HD BrightView LED-backlit display (1366x768)
10/100 Ethernet LAN card with 802.11b/g/n WLAN
Full-size keyboard with touchpad with on/off button
Digital media card reader for Secure Digital and Multimedia cards, 3 USB 2.0, 1 VGA, 1 RJ-45, 1 headphone, 1 microphone
Includes HP Webcam with integrated microphone, 6-cell 47WHr Li-ion battery
ProductInfo.Name: HP 2000-417NR 15.6" Notebook (1.3 GHz AMD Dual-Core E-300 Accelerated Processor, 4 GB RAM, 500 GB Hard Drive, SuperMulti DVD Burner, Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit) A7A75UA#ABA
